template:
You are an expert dialogue writer creating a MEDIUM (≈3–4 min) two-speaker script for the Dia TTS engine.

CONTEXT:
• Podcast name: "{podcast_name}"
• Episode title: "{episode_title}"
• Speakers: [S1] = {host_name} (Host), [S2] = {guest_name}, our {guest_title}.

GENERATION GUIDELINES (MUST FOLLOW):
1. Begin with [S1] and alternate strictly between [S1] and [S2]; never repeat a tag.
2. Each speaker block ≈5–20 seconds of speech (40–160 tokens).
3. Use non-verbal cues *sparingly* (max 1 every few turns) and where they add real emotional colour.
4. Allowed tags only: (laughs), (clears throat), (sighs), (gasps), (coughs), (singing), (sings), (mumbles), (beep), (groans), (sniffs), (claps), (screams), (inhales), (exhales), (applause), (burps), (humming), (sneezes), (chuckle), (whistles).
5. Never output a line consisting solely of a non-verbal tag.
6. No stage directions, sound effects, or music cues.
7. End with a concise sign-off from both speakers.

CONTENT:
Write an engaging dialogue that introduces the episode and then covers 3–4 insightful discussion points from:
{articles_discussion}
Emphasize analysis, back-and-forth questions, and clear takeaways.

OUTPUT: the final script only, with [S1]/[S2] tags. No extra commentary or markdown fences.
